info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:46PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL HARRISON...CENTRAL JEFFERSON...WEST CENTRAL WASHINGTON...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Cadiz, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Weirton, Steubenville, Wellsburg, Toronto, Wintersville, Mingo Junction, Follansbee, Hooverson Heights, New Cumberland, Hopedale, Smithfield, Franklin, Brilliant, Richmond, Empire, Stratton, New Alexandria, Bloomingdale, Newell, and Unionport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Ohio...southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia.
